You're absolutely right. Parallel editing, when done well, can be an incredibly effective tool for creating tension and generating suspense. However, it does take a lot of skill and expertise to use this technique properly. It requires careful attention to detail and an understanding of how different camera shots and angles can be used to convey different emotions and moods.

Additionally, editors often spend a lot of time carefully selecting and sequencing shots, experimenting with different combinations, and adjusting the timing and pacing of each scene to create the desired effect. It's a complex process, but when it's done successfully, it can be incredibly powerful and leave a lasting impression on the audience.
